Reviews.Title: “Great bed, glacial restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Wishes_on_the_road
Reviews.Content: Rooms are modern, spacious and well appointed. Food is okay - portions very small. Glaciers move faster than the food service and the kitchen unresponsive to feedback. Meeting rooms were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “plenty of other options in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: franmck1
Reviews.Content: a pretty bland and uninteresting stay for sure. just leaving and felt compelled to review the hotel. staff were bored looking and definitely not friendly which is so disappointing when visiting a new city. rooms are small and the heat in the rooms hard to set with accuracy which made for 2 rubbish nights sleep. also charging for internet in a modern hotel is simply archaic. on check out not a thank you for staying or did you enjoy your trip which is simply rude especially since service elsewhere has been solidly good. Will come back to Berlin but not cosmo.

Reviews.Title: “Cosmo Hotel”
Reviews.Author: anttonin
Reviews.Content: excellent and spacious room and bathroom, very good bed. The position is also very good and quiet: design is modern minimalistic with quality furniture. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Cosmo Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HWho
Reviews.Content: Booked a preferential rate through Design Hotels as I work for part of the same group in London. The hotel was very slick with a clean modern style. The front desk staff were excellent. The lady receptionist with the short dark hair was especially helpful. She was able to recognise the things we might be interested in doing in Berlin and made some great recommendations. Mauer Park flea market was a highlight, as was White trash a quirky restaurant/bar which looks like a Chinese restaurant but serves delicious German style American food with live bands every night we finished the night with first class cocktails at the Odessa bar nearby. Our room at the Cosmo was light, spacious and very clean. I loved the floor to ceiling windows and the view was great too. Not the prettiest area but really captures Berlin's gritty cool. Bathroom was huge! Beds very comfortable I slept like a log. Bar was very small but pleasantly located in the hotel's comfortable lobby area. We had breakfast one morning and it was pretty good too. Location was good right opposite spittelmarkt metro. One tip...if you want to visit the Reichstag new security regulations mean you must register online a few days prior to your visit. We didn't and missed out! A great trip thanks to the staff at the Cosmo. We liked the Do Not Disturb sign too!

Reviews.Title: “Cosmo Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gflash11
Reviews.Content: Very new, very clean hotel centrally located in Berlin. Nice and attentive staff who truly tried to help in any way possible. Only tried breakfast at the hotel which was good. Small fitness center. Euro sized rooms but they were very clean and didn't lack for nice towels, beds, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: yo c
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpful staff - nothing was too much trouble. Easy to see sights from here, only 25mins from airport in cab. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A very good deal!”
Reviews.Author: chainchina
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very located (walking distance to all main monuments and right next to a metro station), rooms are nice, quiet (on park side, I don't know about the one on street side), service is perfect, breakfast is very good, Well we were very satisfied with our stay and we would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great breakfast, great staff - wonderful anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Miffcollins
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our 1st wedding anniversary weekend in Berlin, and had a great stay at this hotel. Firstly we had to rearrange from a few weeks before, due to strike action at Berlin airport, which we only found out last minute while queueing at the gate at Manchester airport! The hotel were fantastic - we moved our dates with a cancellation fee of one night's stay, but were offered 3 for 2 nights over Easter so it worked out the same. We were fortunate to be offered an upgrade as well, and I have to say the deluxe room is one of the nicest I have ever stayed in, with two massive windows overlooking the park- lovely to lie on the large, extremely comfortable bed looking out at the snow swirling outside the window. The room is pretty warm so if you prefer cool temperatures make sure you check with reception staff how to operate air conditionning. If, like me, you feel the cold then you'll be very happy, especially in winter / spring months. I really liked the look/ feel - simple, unfussy, luxurious. The location is excellent, easy to get around, close to transport if you don't want to walk. Breakfast served until 2pm - this is such a good idea I don't know why more places don't do this.....plus loads of choice and great coffee. Staff are great, very friendly without being overbearing. Thanks to all for making this such a lovely and special stay for our first year anniversary! I definately want to go back to Berlin and I will definately stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Amy1309
Reviews.Content: Room, location, service & breakfast were all excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Super,central,great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Gary F
Reviews.Content: Super hotel in the middle of Berlin.............................................................................East side. Great breakfast.......location is ok......nice rooms.............not that big but big enough.....will be back when we are in Berlin again..............!! Front desk is very helpfull........Hey why do I have to write 300 letters to have this placed in Tripadvisor??

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: annie2301
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed in this hotel a few years ago, but I wasn't a member then so didn't review it at the time. Clean, central and great service here - bent over backwards to help us when we missed a tour bus AND then missed the airport bus. gave us a free lift to catch up with both busses even though they must have thought what lunatics to miss a bus twice. Great breakfasts and service and by the looks of more recent reviews their standards have stayed as high as they were a couple of years ago.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Paul V
Reviews.Content: A good location in Berlin, close to the Museums, excellent breakfast, very nice spacious room, very pleasant staff. I would certainly go back again!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Asim G
Reviews.Content: A very nice small and cosy hotel in a quite neighbourhood of Berlin, just near the Mitte centre. Just opposite the metro with a very good line (U2) and in walking distance of all the museums. The rooms are a little small, but the bathroom is really big and comfortable. I have to mention the front desk staff! They were all of them very friendly, polite and well aware of the city facilities, the events and the transporation. Very professionnal indeed!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: John H
Reviews.Content: The stay was amazing. The hotel was perfectly placed and very reasonable - 233 euros for two nights for two people including breakfast. As soon as I entered the hotel and met the reception team I knew our stay would be good. The hotel was immaculate. The smiles on the faces of the staff when they greated us were very sincere. They made us feel weclome, asked where we were from, first time in belrin etc. They upgraded us to a junior suite without hesitation. A great start. I just loved the room, spacious, well equipped,contemporary. 5 star room without a doubt. The view was perfect from our corner suite. The bed was large and very comfy. Lots of hanging space, mini bar etc. The bar and the restuarant was very modern, cool music playing in the backbground - just a perfect vibe. The hotel was very relaxed and all the staff super friendly. I just loved the late breakfast until 2pm and the late check out at 2pm. Why can't all hotels operate a more relaxed policy like this. The team at reception were the most helpful I've ever met in a hotel, recommending and booking restuarants, organising site seeing tickets and other requests. My thanks to them for making my stay just the best ever. I dont think I've ever given a full 10 out of 10 for a hotel review. This is the first. I will be rebooking when I revisit berlin

Reviews.Title: “Great central location”
Reviews.Author: Chris3D
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at COSMO over New Years and got a good deal considering how expensive some of the hotels are in Berlin around this time. The hotel is just outside of some of the more major attractions, but close enough to easily walk to all the museums (very close) and Brandenburg Gate as well as Potsdamer Platz (maybe 15-20 minute walk). Subway station is just across the street which will also take you to Potsdamer Platz in no time. The hotel is very modern without being too modern (=still comfortable!). Breakfast was included in our deal and I highly recommend it, even if you have to pay a little extra. Great buffet and eggs to order, fresh ingredients from local organic farmers. The room we had was great and well insulated, which is nice as it's on a potentially busy street. Hotel staff was always friendly and happy to help. Free WiFi only in the lobby, that's a bummer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay! Professional staff! Exceptional food!!”
Reviews.Author: StingingBumbleBee
Reviews.Content: I've been meaning to write this review to say thank you to the Cosmo Hotel, Berlin for such a wonderful stay. My partner and I visited in Dec 2011 and the hotel itself was very cosmopolitan and modern. Our package included breakfast, which was to die for. I thoroughly enjoy eating good food and it had everything and more I would have picked for breakfast. For example, as well as having poached eggs on smoked salmon which was tinged with a shade of red, on brown toast with rocket (my favourite), it had a wide selection of other foods to accompany your dish. The Sekt was an additional minor cost at breakfast at just 4-5 euro a glass and made it even more special! I would go back just to stay in the hotel again! I must say that the staff were incredibly helpful in many ways and the service was exceptional - danke!! :O)

Reviews.Title: “Home in Berlin with impeccable Service”
Reviews.Author: Hongkon
Reviews.Content: As a frequent business traveler to Berlin, I really appreciate the COSMO. It feels great to be recognized as a return cuustomer. As reported before, I love the simple, clean and functional design as much as the generous layout and amenities in the corner rooms. Staff continues to bend over backwards to make gueste feel welcome and special. The service is great and the location perfect, if you have to be in "Mitte". I'll definitely be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Simple but beautiful, wonderful breakfast”
Reviews.Author: apprendrelemonde
Reviews.Content: Sumptuous and modern decoration, good sized rooms - light comes in to the rooms and lobby area thorough big windows - creates a light and nice atmosphere. Big bathrooms, comfortable beds & linen. A huge plus is a REALLY comprehensive selection of breakfast - that serves until 2 pm on week-ends, all really nicely served. Attentive staff, a walking distance to many central places, taxi-station just across the street. Only minus was the wi-fi, that was free in the lobby and corridors, but not in the room...In the bathroom you had everything but a conditioner, so (women) travelers - bring your own :)

Reviews.Title: “A great, contemporary hotel in the heart of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: StreamsUK
Reviews.Content: This is a cool and contemporary hotel in the centre of Berlin, within walking distance of all amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, amazingly comfy beds”
Reviews.Author: Jillinthebox
Reviews.Content: The Cosmo was an almost perfect hotel experience. I had a huge room by European standards with a super comfy bed. Big bathroom with an excellent shower that I didn’t want to leave behind. Totally clean and tidy, really fast wi-fi internet connection, and good food. There’s an U-bahn station right outside the door so even though it’s not completely central, it’s easy to get anywhere you want. A couple of little bugbears: the temperature gauge was supposedly designed to be simple, but my room never seemed to get warmer or cooler when I tried to use it. And there was no laundry facility at all, which wasn’t ideal for me. Overall though, excellent, and I’ll definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Ronny625
Reviews.Content: A very comfortable and well fitted out room. Location make it easy to walk to many of the key sites and the staff were helpful. Only observation is that we had to buy a daily wi-fi connection that was the most expensive I have ever come across and that there was no better rate for using it for several days in a row. In 2012 many hotels have wi-fi included.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel I highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Delphine F
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights in a Junior Suite room. The room was amazing: it is modern, but cozy and warm at the same time, we had space, a bath and a raining shower and you can choose the room's temperature. Breakfast is not included and I thought at first it was a bit expensive, but at the end you have a nice and varied buffet, with organic, fresh and good quality products. The staff is very friendly and a concierge is there to help you find a place or recommend one. The hotel is quite in a good location (metro station in front and not so far from the best things to see).

Reviews.Title: “stylish and excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: 10179k79
Reviews.Content: The Cosmo is in an excellent location -- even though the immediate surroundings are not very lively, it is in the very center of Berlin, and any destination can be reached easily. Rooms are very stylish, tasteful, and with high quality furnishings. Generous closet space, very well thought out and practical. Very good - though almost always quite empty - restaurant. Nice staff that leaves nothing to wish for.

Reviews.Title: “Mark and Claire”
Reviews.Author: Mark D
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay. The central position and modern design of the Hotel were very much to our taste and we found the reception staff to be very helpful. We stayed in one of the small suites and, although expensive, thought that the room was great. We would certainly stay again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: andrzej_misztal
Reviews.Content: It is the best hotel I am staying. This year I had more than 20 business trips and three of them to Berlin each time staying in your hotel. I like its interior - it is my style and the friendly atmosphere. I would recommend it to anybody. Looking forward to visit you next time

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great for German markets”
Reviews.Author: scott o
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and feels expensive, simliar to a boutique hotel with a german twist. We had a room upgrade and we were glad that we did, after looking at the fire plan (in the room) other rooms looked a little small. Our room fronted the main road which is heavily trafficed however did not hear anything. Room sound insulation was amazing! The hotel is right opposite the subway - very handy - but on the south south of Mitte, ideally we wanted to stay in central mitte. It was only a 5min walk so we weren't too fussed. Didn't each at the hotel as thought breakfast was a little expensive at 18euro. Overall very impressed with the hotel and would recommend it to anyone, i'm normally very fussy and this is something coming from me.

Reviews.Title: “Modern design hotel”
Reviews.Author: mjla57
Reviews.Content: Modern design hotel in a good location in Berlin. Very friendly staff, nice, comfortable rooms and bathrooms. Great breakfast. The only comment I have that given the hi-tech blinds etc it would have been nice if the staff had explained this and not let the guest figure it out (which I did not do until after the first night)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, location and staff! I wouldn't stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: atreviews2011
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, only across the road to the metro station and taxis called by the hotel arrive within minutes. You can easily walk into the centre of the city. The hotel is very modern, and the lobby area is small but elegant. The rooms are (in my opinion) perfect. The room sizes are on the small side, however everything inside is exceptionally luxurious and modern. The bed was one of the comfiest I have ever slept in. The technology in the room was also impressive, including the electronic blinds, heating/aircon system and tv. The bathroom was fantastic, very clean with a huge rainfall shower. The best thing about this hotel were the staff. They were INCREDIBLY helpful, taking time to show you maps of the city, recommend and book restaurants, and giving great tips for sightseeing and nightlife. When I return to Berlin I will undoubtedly return to the Cosmo.

Reviews.Title: “Very cool!”
Reviews.Author: Tuddee
Reviews.Content: The staff is what made this hotel the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, an all rounder - great location, helpful staff and lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: S H
Reviews.Content: All you need for a break in Berlin - the hotel was in a good location - walking distance to trains, trams and buses . Also close enough to walk to key tourist spots such as the museums, checkpt charlie and the gate. Restaurants and shopping not far way too! The staff at the hotel were both friendly and helpful. Wouldnt hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cosmo”
Reviews.Author: Paul012345
Reviews.Content: Great! Great location, great staff, great food, great rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: Achim K
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel. Will stay again. Really all rooms are apartments. It is situated in a nice location. Hotel room was spotless and had stylish decor with lots of storage and a comfy bed..If you want a pleasant stay in Berlin this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Design hotel in Mitte”
Reviews.Author: Fjellis-58
Reviews.Content: One of the nicer hotels i have stayed at in Berlin. There are more fancy ones, but also more expensive, so if you wish a good hotel near the city core but not far from anything this one is a good choise. Professional and friendly staff. Only thing that was missing in the bathroom was makeup mirror with magnification. (try putting on eyeliner and so on when not wearing your glasses and you´ll find out why these mirrors are handy). Everything else was just great!

Reviews.Title: “The best Hotel in the Centre of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Hongkon
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Cosmo approximately 7 times on my frequent visits to Berlin. Check in, staff, valet parking, exceptionally friendly and efficient. I always stay in a corner room, facing noisy Leipziger Strasse, but no problem. The sound insulation is almost perfect. The rooms are vy tastefully and efficiently appointed. I just love the comfort of the King Size bed, mattress, duvet and linen. Lighting, shutter, aircon controls are very sophisticated and working well. The outside shutters and easy to close black out curtains provide for very comfortable darkness for a god rest. Large flat screen, Internet connection, working space, large closet space.....perfect for "long haul" travelers with luggage. The bathrooms are gorgeous, well appointed, comfortable and spacious. Hand and "rain shower", double sinks, bright airy, just great. Last, but not least, the little bar area at Lobby level is shining with cozy, comfortable seating and excellent service. When going to Berlin, this is my home away from home Breakfast is pricy but excellent. They offer a breakfast to go, healthy little package if you are in a rush, what a neat idea !

Reviews.Title: “Top Glass!”
Reviews.Author: MaltaBear
Reviews.Content: This is one of the nicest bedrooms I have ever stayed in. We were in a corner room, which had floor to ceiling glass along two complete sides. It would have been the best room ever if only there were a more appealing view than the rather drab buildings and the neon cola sign right opposite. The bathroom had wall to ceiling glass too - there is something rather exciting about sitting on the throne and watching the traffic go past many floors below! The twin wash basins were a nice touch, although one was right behind the door. The reception and bar area was rather small, and I am not sure how it would cope if the hotel were full. The restaurant is said to specialise in "aroma" cooking. The night we dined there it was the chef's night off, so we could not put it to a proper test. However, the breakfasts were given a thorough evaluation and they rank among the best there is!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tawnycat28
Reviews.Content: We took a weekend package as a treat after hostels for the last few months and were really happy we did - a typical 4 star, gorgeous room, deliciously comfortable bed, great facilities, yummy breakfast. The staff were lovely, even though I know I don't look like their regular clientele at the moment with my backpack! Pretty central with a U station over the road. My only complaint would be the charge for wifi in the rooms (free in the lobby) - surely if a hostel can provide that service then a hotel like this can too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shooter1103
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel and I will be be back. The room service, the food, the amenities were outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Very good quality, great option considering the room cost”
Reviews.Author: Niebes
Reviews.Content: Stay there just for one nigh. the room is not big but quite good. Great decoration and great bathroom. Besides the bar downstairs, I did not explore the hotel facilities (no time) . The bar service was quite good with free internet (it is not free in the room > this is the only negative aspect I can raise) The hotel atmosphere is very good and the overall service is fantastic. Congratulations to the team.

Reviews.Title: “gorgeous staff”
Reviews.Author: 14paula14
Reviews.Content: good design incredible staff, very friendly and helpfull new rooms, excellent mattress good location, close to subway

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I've stayed in for years”
Reviews.Author: Davesoa
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel and its staff outstanding. The staff, particularly the reception staff, were amongst the best I've ever come across. The greeting on arrival was warm and friendly, the process for checking in efficient, they suggested restaurants and made bookings, gave directions and answered every question posed to them in the same warm efficient manner. The other staff we came across were all similarly friendly and welcoming. We arrived at 10am in the morning and were given access to our room straight away. We'd chosen a junior suite - a substantial double bed, plenty of room to sit and read, a separate shower and bathroom and the usual facilities. The room was spotlessly clean. It had a view over the road outside but the double glazing kept all but the sound of emergency vehicle sirens out. There is complimentary wi-fi in the lobby, you have to pay for wired access, but I found we could easily get a signal in our room and connect for free from there. The hotel is well positioned for sightseeing. There is a underground station just over the road. A walk to Check Point Charlie took about 10 minutes, to Unter Den Linden about 15 minutes, Museum Island 15 minutes, Nikolaivertel 5 minutes, Brandenburg Gate 20 minutes. There is a good selection of restaurants within 5 minutes walk in Gendarmenmarkt as well as local shops. We only had breakfast at the hotel - there is a restaurant should you not feel like walking.

Reviews.Title: “Delighted with our choice ......”
Reviews.Author: Sukamakan
Reviews.Content: Excellent bed, good size bedroom and bathroom. great staff very helpful. Only had one lunch but it was very good. Breakfast also well presented and good selection. It would have been nice if we had complimentary wi fi plus tea and coffee facilities but that's a European issue not just Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: schrams
Reviews.Content: modern style, very friendly, very relaxing atmosphere, lounge music in the restaurant, stylish rooms, friendly stuff

Reviews.Title: “Home from Home”
Reviews.Author: gadaboutmalta
Reviews.Content: A laid back and quiet hotel that makes it ideal place to stay. The large room had space to relax, work and sleep. It felt more like an apartment than a hotel which is a blessing while travelling. Just would have loved coffee making facility in the room. The breakfast was the best layout and quality that I have found this year and a great start to the day.

Reviews.Title: “superb new modern and true design hotel”
Reviews.Author: mstMerelbeke
Reviews.Content: very satisfied about the clean and modern design hotel with well trained staff and exquisite foods.

Reviews.Title: “Tight”
Reviews.Author: martinbonds
Reviews.Content: Friendly, quite, good food and well stocked bar. 10 minutes from club Berghain.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel close to city centre”
Reviews.Author: MatthewNilan
Reviews.Content: An elegant, boutique-style hotel with an excellent restaurant. Our room, a deluxe, was very spacious and airy. Two very minor gripes: wi-fi was not included in the room rate and, at 6.50 euros a night, wasn't cheap; and the air conditioning was hard to operate, leaving our room too hot at night. Very good value for money, though, for a very stylish and comfortable, city centre hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back”
Reviews.Author: liesvd
Reviews.Content: The room was very comfortable, the bed very large and the bathroom included everything we needed. One aspect we didn't like very much, were the pillows. They were too soft. We were very surprised off the help we got when we arrived at the hotel. There was a man who helped us with our bags towards our room. That's something we aren't used to. The waitresses at breakfast were very kind, and very quick to ask us if we wanted to have 'Warme Speisen'. We enjoyed the good tempered, always friendly personnel. If we come back to Berlin in probably three years, we will again choose for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, centric and excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: Tesfaya
Reviews.Content: Centric hotel, walking distance to main areas in Berlin, pricing really fair, amazing design and what i appreciated the most was the magnificent service the personal gave us. If i come back definetely it will be at Cosmo Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: RnoAlex
Reviews.Content: Great location, we booked quite ahead and therefore had a good rate for the room. Good bike rental system.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Modern hotel located near attractions/ restaurants”
Reviews.Author: doingstuff
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Cosmo Hotel Berlin. The rooms were clean and spacious. The beds were very comfortable. If you leave the windows open you will hear city noise so we recommend reading about the ceiling air conditioning (slightly different then normal). The breakfast is good but for 18 euros it is worth walking two blocks to many cafes situated nearby. We would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: roving_sam
Reviews.Content: - Room very spacious - pleasant bright room to occupy - found the bed mattress a little soft but not uncomfortable - staff at front desk helpful and pleasant - reduced menu option at lunch practical for numbers - both burger and steaks very good - bar area a little limited but I guess sufficient for number of guests - excellent location

Reviews.Title: “Great design hotel, will defenetely come back.”
Reviews.Author: Alma_k
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at the Cosmo Hotel. I was thinking of anything to complain about but I cant think of anything negative of the hotel. It is very well located and you can walk easily to the centre and main attractions. The staff is lovely and very nice. The breakfast was great. If you include it in your reservation i think it is a little cheaper than if you buy it seperately afterwards. Its a wonderful buffet including all you can think off: Cereals, yoghurts, fresh fruits, meats, cheeses, jams, different sauces, different fesh breads, juices of all kinds, smoked salmon, etc. Teas and coffee. You can also have an egg dish that will be prepared with what you like best, (champignons, herbs...). The design of the rooms are great. Everything is clean and tidy. The bed is a little bit too soft for my taste, but I normally like very very hard mattrasses. The sheets are new and very cosy. the bathroom is also very clean and a nice minimalistic design. There is laundry service, a safe, a minibar (which unfortunatley is not free! in fact its quite expensive), TV... We will come back in our next visit to Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the stay !”
Reviews.Author: ledudechris
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, friendly personal, great breakfast but don't ask for room 709 because for a new hotel unbelievable but true they forgot drapes on side of the room so every day a 5.30 we were awake! Nice sauna but often no water (and unlike in other hotels of the same rate no fruit). And believe it or not no free internet in the room only in the lobby and this unlike other hotels of the same rate! Machteld & Chris from Balgium

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel in Mitte with friendly helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: dazzainthedam
Reviews.Content: If you like a room with style and elegance this is the one for you. Added bonus of gym and sauna. Delicious breakfasts too! S-bahn on doorstep so easy to explore the city or get to work in my case. All in all well worth a stay!

Reviews.Title: “lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: foxlai
Reviews.Content: We really liked the room (401), silent and clean. The staff was very friendly and always helpful. We find the breakfast too expensive and We think the hotel should improve the number of bikes for the clients. We stayed 6 days and we never had the chance to book them in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for discovering Berlin”
Reviews.Author: CeesF
Reviews.Content: Booked in a rush, but what a gem! Best comfy-est beds ever and a stylish bathroom. Friendly and helpful staff. Contemporary yet humanistic style. The hotel offers a great healthy breakfast. The whole experience was simply beyond expectation and could not be improved upon. We went with a family of four and felt at home immediately. The hotel is located 10 min walking distance from 'Unter den Linden' and overall it offers a great position for discovering Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD EXPERIENCE IN THE COSMO HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: 92150bobby
Reviews.Content: We did appreciate our stay in this hotel for the following reasons: . Very good central location in BERLIN . Clean and modern premisses . Helpful staff, mainly at the reception desk . Comfortable bedroom with attractive bathroom . Good cooking ( Breakfast & Dinner) The only remark refers to the ground floor: we usually appreciate much a more spacious Bar & Lounge where we can rest, have a drink and stay longer with friends. The COSMO Lounge is too narrow and not handy enough.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect balance”
Reviews.Author: marcellosano
Reviews.Content: Good staff, service, rooms. Walking distance from Berlin's main attraction. It was a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “new, nice, good value”
Reviews.Author: zack-jesse
Reviews.Content: nice new hotel, modern, comfortable, xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx

Reviews.Title: “I did like it!”
Reviews.Author: StrafHD
Reviews.Content: It has been a pleasent stay and it agreable hotel. I will return back again. Very good breakfast quality, nice people a good staff!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent service, excellent Berlin”
Reviews.Author: WillSilverstone
Reviews.Content: Loved Cosmo. Great experience, probably heightened by our upgrade to the Jnr. Sweet - its a good way to start any holiday. The room was perfect, and very comfortable/easy to stay in. The staff were friendly and always helpful, whether with directions, recommendations or reservations. It is situated perfectly in Mitte allowing easy access to all the amazing cultural activities Berlin had ton offer. A very memorable holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: MissTina7
Reviews.Content: The service was impeccable from the minute we arrived to the minute we left. Facilities were comfortable and luxurious. The best experience combined with value for money at a European hotel. Advice given was thorough and spot on. Staff went beyond the usual, 'here's a map and the main monuments'. They were able to make suggestions appropriate to our age and apparent style and they could answer any question. In particular, the porter was fantastic and the blonde lady (day) and young man (night) who worked behind the desk of the weekend of 16/17th April.

Reviews.Title: “Get an impression of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Kwintessens
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located very well to walk into the part of Berlin where a lot of highlights are present. There is also a U-Bahn station on the other site of the road. This kind of transport is easy to use and brings you all over Berlin. The hotel sells Berlin Welcome Cards. Use them! You can hear the sounds of the running underground trains in your room; that is not very disturbing. Sounds of busy traffic, in front of the hotel, is also not mentionable. Breakfast is chique and "design-like", but not very practical. Bread was dry and typical German. The temperature in our room was to high; airco was not functioning well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent. A modern and desing hotel in the middle of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Dovichiosa
Reviews.Content: A desing hotel with all the commodities you would expect, in the centre of Berlin, close to the main interesting tourist points.

Reviews.Title: “Fresh, clean hotel with high standard.”
Reviews.Author: Magnus75
Reviews.Content: Nice modern rooms with high standard and very good acoustical comfort, low traffic noise and good sound insulation from rooms and hall. Good restaurant, French kitchen. Location could be better, but not totally off. You can reach most places within 10 euro cab ride and the Metro is just outside. Not much nightlife in the neighborhood though.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: ab69
Reviews.Content: This is one of the many hotels that I have visited in my 10-12 trips to Berlin. It is not bad at all and very very clean, also the location is good, not so turistic but very close to all the attractions (expecially the Museum Insel). I think that the right rate is 4.5/5 and not 4/5, but it is a pity that you can give the half-point...... I am still thinking about giving 5/5 rate, but the breakfast is really poor for a this standard hotel. The quality of the food is good, but the choice and the service are very low. This is the reason why I still prefer John F hotel, that is very close, but I think that Cosmo can improve this aspect very quickly (and I hope for them).

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous and great Price”
Reviews.Author: jimnvez
Reviews.Content: found cosmo on a Berlin Boutique hotel website, booked at 4pm the night i was staying, Nico on reception was great and helped me find a great restaurant, forgot my toothbrush, they had one, forgot my phone charger, they had one, fantastic service, rooms were lovely, really clean, fresh and modern, will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: syrixo
Reviews.Content: Design hotel -excellelent breakfast; eggs te way you want, muesly, all kinds of bread; cheese, meat.... -we had the disabled room, was very spacious, beautiful, clean, flat tv -friendly staff -one hour free wifi a day -a few steps away from u-bahn Only 2 remarks; - could not adjust the heating, so it was to hot in the room at night and than (for some people perhaps stupid), but it was not dark enough in the room for me to get a good nightrest...

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel, don't expect design.”
Reviews.Author: Dutch-Peeky
Reviews.Content: Attractions are not within walking distance. The design of the junior suite is great. Unfortunately no free Wifi, no inroom coffee facilities. Personnel is friendly, but not personal. The breakfast is great, capuccino and your preferred eggs on request. Extra facilities like sauna not introduced or explained.

Reviews.Title: “Very central and connected hotel in Mitte, very quiet and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: skndainese
Reviews.Content: Pure design rooms, comfortable large bed, very quiet rooms even if standards one are a bit small but fortunatly with large windows over the city. Just missing : a real fitness room (very small room in fact with no exterior windows), no iPod doc/music player in the room and fees for wifi connexions. Also not much international TV programs... but well, no need to waste time in front of the tely when u're in Berlin, there is way better fun!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect weekend in Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: wgoater
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on the recommendation of a friend who raved about it. We were not disappointed. No expense has spared in decorating this beautiful design hotel. Normally I am not a fan of the modern, but this place is REALLY well done! Our welcome could not have been friendlier. All of the staff must have been trained in the Disney school of friendliness - all young and gorgeous, but none of if over the top. We had a standard room which although small, lacked non of the comforts and design features. I esp. appreciated the salon-style hairdryer even though I had brought my own after trying to dry my hair with the standard hotel hair dryers which are more suitable for drying your hands. Thank you! Only two drawbacks were the brand new internet system in the rooms which no-one seemed to know how to use. Also, the room temperature was a little difficult to adjust and we were a little too warm at night.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Place”
Reviews.Author: csaa1480
Reviews.Content: Really fantastic hotel, quite new and operating under the "Design Hotels" franchise/brand. Pefect spot, super convenient location (10 mins walk to Friedrichstrasse, underground just across the street), really "over the top" friendly staff, excellent choice of breakfast and very nice, modern and quite spacious rooms (some rooms are smaller but even those have a good layout). Overall: simply superb.

Reviews.Title: “we enjoyed every sec in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: prnc
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to drop you a note to say how much we enjoyed our recent stay (18-22 Dec). The hotel is wonderful, and everything we were looking for. We reserved a deluxe room and was indeed like this. We were accommodated in a quiet, spacious room facing a park covered with snow. This place has invested a lot on design and the outcome is a modern vibrant hotel. In particular, it was refreshing to deal with staff who (without exception) were friendly, helpful and efficient. We enjoyed every aspect of our stay there, starting with the first impression of a design modern fresh room, a confortable bed, a big bathroom, breakfast buffet with a great gourmet choice and all the above with a frank smile of the personnel. We would definitely recommend The Cosmo Hotel and hope to return soon as we left many things unseen

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel, best nights sleep!”
Reviews.Author: fatherof1
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel advertised soon after it had opened earlier in the year and grabbed the introductory discount offer, despite some poor reviews. We were confident that the minor niggles others had written were teething problems and our stay proved it so. A modern block on a busy road, it does not boast a large name board, so we missed it when emerging from the Ubahn across the road! A warm reception by fluent english speaking staff, our luggage was whisked away by a porter. Our seventh floor room looked out to the rear, had a balcony, viewing onto residential blocks and silence. Superb shower room with comfy robes and towels, and even slippers. The best air conditioning I have ever had in any hotel, silent and effective. Roller blinds inside the room and outer Venetian blinds, electrically operated from a multifunction control panel. The bed. King size with a generous mattress topper. It was some of the best nights sleep I remember having, ever. A free sauna along the floor and a small multigym on the eigth floor. The breakfast had good variety and never ran out of good quality local fare. Superb staff, high quality and a quiet location made this a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: kfironit
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights in Berlin with a friend, both of us being in town for the first time, and coming for a weekend to view the Photography Festival in town. We chose the hotel after a long search on the web, reviewing locations, prices and styles of more than 25 places. As we are both designers, the look and feel of the hotel was very important to us, and we hoped we chose well. The hotel proved to be even better than the photos. The design was clean but warm, attention given to smallest details (shampoo and soap bottles from corn, with bamboo and lemongrass scent which will always remind us of this vacation, great and simple bedlinen, even beautifully designed corridors..), the staff was friendly, warm and always helpful (umbrellas waiting for guests on their way out to another rainy day..). The location - just across the street from the Spittlemarkt U-Bahn station, and 5 minutes walk from the beautiful Gendarmenmarkt square was great even though on a main road (we actually loved the East-Berlin look of the tall buildings on it). For breakfast we took twice their service of "Breakfast To Go" for only 8 Euros, which included a sandwich, chocolate bar, fruit, smoothie and a hot beverage. We have both absolutely nothing bad to say about this hotel, will definitely come back and recommend it warmly to old and new comers to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Stefan B
Reviews.Content: The Staff is very friendly and helpfull, the rooms are comfortable and clean. Even though my room was facing the main road he windows had such good isolation that I slept without any disruptions all night. The breakfast is the best I/ have ever had, fresh, with lots of nice details and the breakfast team is just very friendly and professional. We also enjoyed the lounge in the night and had a wine that the bar guy suggested, yummy! Overall a great stay! We will be back without any doubt! /Stefan

Reviews.Title: “What we expected”
Reviews.Author: Kleio_p
Reviews.Content: The hotel was what we expected for a short city break in Berlin. Very close to the metro station (Spittelmarkt) just on the other side of the road it was perfect for us. The hotel was recently renovated and you could tell it was Building of the Ost-Berlin era with a modern interior design. The rooms were very cosy and clean with the most wonderful views because of the floor-to-ceiling windows! The personel was very polite and helpful and english-speaking english - we were lucky enough to find a greek member of the staff who was more than generous with tips. Don't hesitate to ask questions and tips they won't let you down.

Reviews.Title: “Pefect for a break in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: ATraveller_7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cosmo Berlin Mitte from 6-10 September. The hotel is located opposite the U-bahn station with frequent trains that connect you across the city. On arrival staff were very friendly and even though we had arrived early our room was ready. We had requested feather free bedding which they had arranged on arrival. The rooms are modern in design with a good sized bathroom with lovely shower. The bed was very comfortable. Despite our room overlooking a main road, there was little noise. We didn't eat in the restaurant so could not comment on this but there are a few nice restaurants and bars nearby. Getting to the hotel is very easy from Schonefeld airport. Buy a travel pass or ticket for the airport express train and transfer at Alexaderplatz onto the U-bahn only took about 30-40 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Pearl-Travellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at Cosmo Hotel and loved it. We found it through Designhotels.com, so knew that the decor and style of the facility would not disappoint. Our double room -- a corner room on the 4th floor -- was very neatly and tastefully appointed. It was also very big with a great bathroom. The bed and bedding was plush and comfortable -- not too soft, not too firm. Floor-to-ceiling glass showed a nice urban view, which could be entirely blocked by full curtains. So our room was nicely dark in the morning. The road in front of the hotel was quiet at night. We found the hotel easily from the Spittl Markt UBahn stop. From the hotel it was easy to walk to the Berlin Wall Museum, Fredrickstrasse, Potzdamer Platz, Museum Island, etc. Truly, a good location in the Mitte. The only drawback was that there really wasn't any nearby night life or fun shops for browsing. We did not interact much with the staff, but they secured a taxi for us to Tegel airport on the morning we left. It was on time and had plenty of room for luggage. The cab ride to the airport was about 20 Euro -- well worth it. We had drinks in the bar -- typical prices for drinks. The service was polite and quick.

Reviews.Title: “We were afraid to stay at the Cosmo after negative reviews BUT...”
Reviews.Author: firenzesimon69
Reviews.Content: ...we decided NOT to cancel our reservation, & go stay at the Cosmo Hotel anyway! The Cosmo to us was WONDERFUL. Especially for those of you who *drive* and really need secure parking, but BOOK YOUR PARKING SPACE AHEAD. They took very good care of our (luxury) slk 350 car and we got a great deal on a Deluxe Room by booking a couple months in advance on Cosmo's own website. Our Deluxe Room at the Cosmo was extremely spacious, & kept very clean. We were in a Deluxe room on the fourth floor with a beautiful view of a lovely park with tall, lush trees, colorful jungle gyms , & very-cared-for lawn and gardens. There were also sleek corporate office buildings and nice residential/private apartment buildings surrounding this park, too--- which gave the perfect Urban Chic setting & concept that the Cosmo Hotel is successfully conveying. Cosmo's Restaurant also faces this same urban park giving the restaurant and breakfast in the morning a wonderful, tranquil view. At the front of the hotel is a big boulevard. That boulevard takes you into very important directions of the city which we found were very strategic. So the hotel IS VERY WELL POSITIONED. Another previous reviewer said that it was not. That was untrue as far as we are concerned, and we stayed there five nights. We actually walked several times to the beautiful Gendarmarkt & Checkpoint Charlie areas and we did ALOT of driving to and from the hotel and found that we were *easily* able to get anywhere and everywhere within HUGE XL BERLIN in a matter of minutes from the Cosmo! It was easy to get to Prenzlauer berg, Kreuzberg districts, and close enough to Tiergarten, Museum Island / Alexander Platz, etc. If you have a good quality, updated navigator, noone should have any problems touring berlin, period. If you are the type that wants to take public transportation, the Cosmo is also near a U-Bahn stop. The bath product amenities were NOT as bad as one previous reviewer described. The fragrance base is Bamboo & Verbena which is a very fresh, "lemony" scent & also unisex. Linens & Towels were extremely clean and white & plush, and the bathroom design was very simple, extremely modern with good BRIGHT LIGHTING and high-quality fixtures. (And by the way, don't bring a hairdryer because Cosmo has the best professional grade hairdryer that I have ever seen for courtesy use in a room at ANY hotel in a 4-star category and up!) Thanks Cosmo for that nice little "extra"! In the Deluxe bedroom we had a combination Shower/Bathtub which was great. We even tried the 18 euro BIO/Organic Breakfast that was very good, but maybe missing the hot mini sausages, golden brown breakfast potatoes, & cold Champagne mimosas that many hotels at Cosmo's level, do tend to include within their lavish breakfast buffets. The young Cosmo Staff was extremely friendly to us, without being intrusive at all. We really appreciate all of their kindness, all of the help and professionalism that we received from *Tim & Nicco* in particular. Tim also took care of our car and parking, and he understood immediately just how important our vehicle is to us! Tim made sure that his other colleagues who parked our car took extra care of it too! (THANKS, TIM!) There were also two other friendly ladies part of the Cosmo staff at the reception desk: one pretty lady with long blond hair & an equally lovely, petite, brunette who also spoke very good italian & spanish which is so good for any latino guests who may not speak english or german very well. When in Berlin, the Cosmo is a very good hotel for all of the reasons given earlier. We would LOVE to go back there the next time we visit Berlin. We know exactly what they offer and we feel very comfortable there. Please keep up the good work Cosmo! Stay just the way you are and DO NOT CHANGE! Arrivederci.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel! Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: pasodoble5
Reviews.Content: I recently spent nearly a week at Cosmo Hotel while traveling with friends to Berlin. I was lucky enough to be given a first floor room, as these appear to be family sized rooms. My room came with a very comfortable bed, more than ample storage space, a double vanity and a separate room with a toilet. The hotel was very clean, and the staff was very friendly. My room rate of just over 100 euro per night was very reasonable, especially given the recent dip in the value of the euro. I will say that my friends were given a much smaller fourth floor room that was much less opulent than my room. Still, it was more than adequate in size, and the nice features, great service, great price and great location more than made up for the size of the room. There is a stop for the U-Bahn across the street from the hotel, and there are restaurants, coffee shops and food stores closeby. This hotel would be wonderful for both business and leisure trips, and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great design, great service”
Reviews.Author: Marlovak
Reviews.Content: For design / architecture fans, this is a fantastic hotel. From the rooms to the public spaces, it feels great to spend time there. They used beautiful materials and simple, but thoughtful layouts. The rooms are relatively simple, but again, beautifully designed. The beds are heavenly -- featherbeds, down duvets, great pillows. The bathrooms are spacious and simple and the complimentary cosmetics smell wonderful. The breakfast room / restaurant is fantastic with high cielings, huge windows to the street and attentative service. The breakfast food is again simple, but excellent quality. We had room service one night as well and that also was very good. We also received very good service from the front-desk when we asked for some advice on where to go. We particularly appreciated the advice where not to go (i.e. ugly or boring) as this is often missing. The only things that didn't thrill me were: 1. The in-room electronics (i.e. heating, shades, TV, etc.) are a bit fussy. The less technically tolerant will probably be frustrated by these 'toys'. 2. There was no way to eat anything after 10:30 PM 3. The location is good -- but you still need a good 20 min walk to the main attractions

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: Arturas
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights in this hotel and had a great time. Location is very good. Metro is just on the corner. Service is very quick and friendly. Breakfast very good and people working during breakfast were very attentive and service minded.A great idea that breakfast in the weekend is served till 2 pm. As mentioned before by another reviewer, I agree that rooms were very warm. We stayed end of march and it wasn't warm outside but even then we had to keep windows open to get rooms to normal temperatures ( from 24-25c to 21-22c), even at night we kept one window open to be able to sleep. On the other side we found beds very comfortable! Bathroom quite big with seperate toilet. Was not impressed by hotel's choice of cosmetic brand used in bathroom. The wifi is not available in the room. it is available though in the lobby. Strange, wifi should be a part of service in all new hotels. The hotel definately has a potential to become a place to stay when in Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Great Everything, but Pillows Too Soft”
Reviews.Author: C_and_MH
Reviews.Content: Friendly service, fast internet, modern design, good size rooms and very quiet. While I found the bed to be comfortable, the pillows are deflated and too soft. Also, in my particular room the TV is positioned too low and it blocked by the desk when watching from bed.

Reviews.Title: “Charmless Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jean_76_Paris
Reviews.Content: I visited Berlin as a tourist in March with my girlfriend. The first feeling I had when i get to this hotel was quite cold. The U-bahn stop is right there and for this reason the location seems good but the area is unattractive. There are no shops or street life. It isn't an area for tourism. The hotel staff seemed too formal and distant. The design and decoration of the hotel are well kept but the standard rooms are not practice because there isn't enough suitable space or a closet for storing clothes. Also, the rooms' temperature is too hot all time. The worst was not to enjoy free wi-fi signal in the room. I think that in the XXI century the Internet is not a service either. It is a necessity that should be included in the default rate. Finally, a hotel worker was not enough polite to us (and not talking about bellboy that is a lovely guy). In short, the hotel is not suitable for a recreational stay. We assume that this hotel has been made for business travelers who are going to stay few days with little luggage . I've been in other hotels in Berlin, where my stay was enjoyable and cheap. Berlin is too especial city to spend your stay in a hotel without any charm.

Reviews.Title: “Issues at Cosmo Hotel and bad customer service”
Reviews.Author: Pascal U
Reviews.Content: On March 18 2010 we checked in for 3 nights in a Junior Suite (room 604) • Great design of the room, lobby and the restaurant. • Great and convenient location. • Excellent service and friendly staff in the restaurant for breakfast with the staff trying to remember our room number and coffee order. • Nice complimentary (small) gym and sauna. • House keeping does a great job and the rooms were immaculately clean. • The rooms are really sound proof. No noise from the hallway or outside. • Late breakfast on Saturday and Sunday and the late checkout on Sunday. There are a few negative points: • After check-in we had to find the room ourselves and there was no assistance from the staff showing the hotel and the room. • We had a problem with opening the door the first time. A member of staff came to our floor to help us. He went back to the reception 3 times to make new cards, before he realised our and his mistake in using the card. This took about 20 minutes before we got into our room. It appeared that the staff member did not know how to open the door. • We were greeted on the TV screen as Mr and Mrs. Not all guests are Mr & Mrs, but could also be Mr & Mr. • Part of the Design Hotel Club Welcome Rate was a Welcome Gift. There was no gift in the room and we never received the Welcome Gift. • The room was very hot at a constant 24 degrees. We asked the staff for assistance in using the air-conditioning, but were told that because it was cold outside the air-conditioning was turned off. Unfortunately the only way to get the room cooler was to open the windows. Even with all the windows open, we never got the temperature lower than 22 degrees. • We asked 3 members of the staff if parking was allowed on the square in front of the Asian restaurant and were told this should not be a problem. Unfortunately, we found out parking is not allowed and got a parking ticket. We contacted Design Hotels on March 26th to report these issues and were told that the Management of the Cosmo Hotel would get back to us as soon as possible. Unfortunately they never did.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel not ready to operate and poor service”
Reviews.Author: fredandchris
Reviews.Content: We stayed at COSMO Hotel during the Easter week-end. The design of the hotel is interesting and the location is convenient as very close to many venues. However, we experienced several issues that spoiled our week-end. First, the air conditioning was not working and our deluxe room was too warm (above 25°C). We reported the problem to the staff, initially they blamed us for not being able to use the air conditioning system properly but as we insisted they were forced to admit that the system was not working and that the only solution was to open the window. The hotel being on a very large avenue, opening the window was not an option as too noisy. We asked if we could move to another room. They first offer a smaller room that we declined and finally moved us to another room at the back of the hotel which was less warm and calmer (park view). It is a shame that the alternative room was not offered to us naturally and that we had to beg for it and waste one hour. Overall, the staff is poorly trained and the service provided is not what you expect in a design hotel. Another example, during the breakfast the waitress and then the breakfast manager kept interrupting us claiming that breakfast was not included in our rate. We had to explain that we had already pre-paid for the breakfast and that the problem was in their system. They did not listen to us and kept mentioning that breakfast was not included. It became so embarrassing that we decided to leave and have our breakfast at the Kempinski. Staff has a very limited command of English which does not help. When checking out, we gave our feedback and the staff ensured us that the General Manager will contact us when he returns to apologize for the inconvenience. He never contacted us, that shows how little he cares for the customers. So in conclusion, brand new hotel not ready to operate and poor service by undertrained staff, many better options in Berlin….

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: gerlando-all
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cosmo Hotel for 4 nights over Easter 2010 and even though we're not used to spend much time in the hotel, we have to admit that this is an outstanding 4 stars hotel. Standard rooms are a bit tiny but lovely, brand new furnitures, contemporary design, bright huge windows, king size bed, clean and comfortable bathroom with a superb shower box. Breakfast was a must have. From the sweets to the fruits, from the different variety of breads and juices to the fresh omelette everything was so delicious! Staff were attentive and helpful, sometimes a bit lost in translation but always smiling and attentive. U-bahn stop just in front of the main entrance of the hotel, even though you may even forget the public transportation and just walk for about 10 minutes to reach most of the main turistic areas.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: greece4ever
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cosmo Hotel for a couple of nights at a great opening deal they had and enjoyed our stay there very much. We had a nice room, a bit smallish, but smartly designed with a quite spacious bathroom and very high ceilings which made the room airy and not small. Staff was kind and efficient, and our only problem was breakfast which could have been a bit better for a 4 star hotel, but it's a minor one. The U bahn Spittelmarkt is just outside and the heart of Mitte is a 10min walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel that has just opened”
Reviews.Author: chiswickman
Reviews.Content: Just across the road from the U bahn - the Cosmo seems like it was once an office building. The foyer is stylish and light and the check in staff were friendly. The room i was staying in was beautiful, 2 massive floor to ceiling windows, overlooking a park with views on the Berlin sites. Good desk to work on, large bed, nice flat screen TV and seating area, ample space. Wonderful bathroom. The hotel was very quiet (did not seem to be many guests there). Breakfasts were good and not expensive, wonderful fruit juice. Some communication difficulties with staff whose English was patchy. Not sure how staff with cope with a full hotel though as they could only really work at a slow pace. Had the special business lunch - 14euros for two courses, which was the best food I had in Berlin. Free wifi in the hotel foyer. Nice bar too. Part of the Design Hotels group - which is usually an indication of quality. Looking on the map - you might think the area is not that central - but in fact only 5 minutes walk from the museum island area. Lots of nice restaurants in the area too. Perfect place to get away from things in a quiet but lovely hotel atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel”
Reviews.Author: GB1970
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Cosmo in Berlin and had a great time. The rooms are very high quality with a great bed.. everyhting worked really well, the wifi was fast and the tv system was really good with a wide selection of channels and films. Service in the hotel was superb throughout.. you can tell the staff are proud of the hotel and like working there.

Reviews.Title: “New Hotel on the Mitte Block”
Reviews.Author: northyorkshireboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 weeks after it opened. Staff couldn't do enough to make us feel welcome. Really attentive. hope it stays that way when it gets busy. Location is 5 minutes walk from Alexander Platz but not exactly in the thick of it, next to a 4 lane road that leads up to Potsdammer Platz. U-Bahn is the other side of the road from the hotel. Litterally 5 secs if you dash over. Not recommended - people tend to wait for Berlin's little green man. Rooms are modern and beautiful. and the full length windows made it feel much more spacious than it was. the whole place looks like it's had a heap of money spent on it, kitting it out with trendy design furntiure. Breakfast again, was varied, of high quality with the ever attentive staff. all this for 99 euros. Once this place gets going, gets a bit of night life in the bar, it'll be hard to beat in the Mitte area.

HotelInfo.Name: COSMO Hotel Berlin Mitte
HotelInfo.Address: Spittelmarkt 13, 10117 Berlin, Germany
